topics.body:
Hey I just thought of something interesting:
Edward Snowden is a anime fan and watched Ghost in the Shell; Anonymous is a direct reference as well.

Could it be said that the Laughing Man arc is making real life Laughing Men?


For those of you that don't get the reference massive spoilers below:
[spoiler]Laughing Man is a fictional character in ghost in the shell and nor is he the original laughing man nor the only laughing man while being the original.  What I mean by this is that the Laughing Man was motivated by a email to the Gynomics in Ghost in the Shell to steal confidential information and leak it to the public and as a result other completely unrelated individuals that had never met before copied each other all with a singular purpose working as a hivemind without understanding each other's motivations or anything about each other for a common goal.[/spoiler]


If that's the case then I'm legitimately surprised that Ghost in the Shell hasn't been banned or censored or black listed from production if it's spawning real life copies.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
